title: Êó•Êú¨‰∫∫ÈÄôÂÖ©Âπ¥Ëñ™Ê∞¥ÈÉΩÂ§ßÊº≤ÔºüË™øÊü•ÂëàÁèæÂÖ©Ê®£ÊÉÖ
text:
Êó•Êú¨Áúã‰ººÂ∑≤Á∂ìÊì∫ËÑ´Ê≥°Ê≤´Âåñ‰ª•‰æÜÁöÑÁ∂ìÊøüÂÅúÊªØÊôÇÊúüÔºå‰ªäÂπ¥ 3 ÊúàÊò•È¨•ÂæåÔºåÊó•Êú¨ÊúÄÂ§ßÂ∑•ÊúÉÁà≠ÂèñÂà∞ 30 Âπ¥‰æÜÊúÄÈ´òÁöÑËñ™Ë≥áÊº≤ÂπÖÔºåÊó•Êú¨ÊîøÂ∫úÁõºÊúõÁöÑÂèØÊåÅÁ∫åËñ™Ë≥á‰∏äÊº≤ÊÑà‰æÜÊÑàÊàêÁÇ∫ÁèæÂØ¶„ÄÇ‰ΩÜ‰∫ãÊÉÖÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÂ¶ÇË°®Èù¢ÈÄôÈ∫ºÁæéÂ•ΩÔºåË™øÊü•È°ØÁ§∫ÔºåÂç†Â∞±Ê•≠‰∏ÉÊàêÁöÑ‰∏≠Â∞è‰ºÅÊ•≠ÔºåËñ™Ë≥áÊº≤ÂπÖË¢´ÈÄöËÜ®ÂêÉÊéâ„ÄÇ
Êó•Êú¨ÈÄöËÜ®ÊÑà‰æÜÊÑàÂö¥ÈáçÔºå‰∏ªË¶ÅÊòØÈ£üÂìÅ„ÄÇÁπº 2 ÊúàÈ£üÂìÅÂÉπÊ†º‰∏äÊº≤ 5% ‰πãÂæåÔºå 3 ÊúàÈ£üÂìÅÂÉπÊ†ºÂÜç‰∏äÊº≤ 5.6% ÔºåÁÇ∫ 2024 Âπ¥ 1 Êúà‰ª•‰æÜÊúÄÂø´ÁöÑÂπ¥Â∫¶Êº≤ÂπÖ„ÄÇ 3 Êúà‰∏ªÈ£üÁ±≥ÂÉπÈ£ÜÂçá 92.4% ÔºåÁÇ∫ 1976 Âπ¥‰ª•‰æÜÁöÑÊúÄÂ§ßÊº≤ÂπÖÔºåÁ∂ìÊøüÂ≠∏ÂÆ∂Ë™çÁÇ∫ÔºåÈ£üÂìÅÂíåÈ£≤ÊñôÂÉπÊ†ºÁöÑ‰∏äÊº≤Ê≠£ÈÄêÊº∏ÊàêÁÇ∫Ê∞∏‰πÖÊÄßÁèæË±°ÔºåÊØèÂÄãÊó•Êú¨ÂÆ∂Â∫≠ÈÉΩÊúÉÊÑüÂèóÂà∞ÁîüÊ¥ªÊàêÊú¨‰∏äÊº≤ÁöÑÂ£ìÂäõ„ÄÇ
‰ª£Ë°®ÊÄß‰∏çË∂≥ Ëñ™Ë≥á‰∏äÊº≤ËÆìÂÆ∂Â∫≠ËÉΩÂ§†ÊäµÁ¶¶ÈÄöËÜ®ÂΩ±ÈüøÔºåÊòØÊó•Êú¨Â§ÆË°åÂçáÊÅØÊ±∫Á≠ñÁöÑÈóúÈçµ„ÄÇÊó•Êú¨ÊúÄÂ§ßÂãûÂ∑•ÁµÑÁπîÂãûÂ∑•ËÅØÂêàÊúÉ (Rengo) ÔºåÊìÅÊúâÁ¥Ñ 700 Ëê¨ÂêçÊúÉÂì°Ôºå3 Êúà‰∏≠ÂÖ¨Â∏ÉÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∫åËº™Âπ¥Â∫¶ÂãûË≥áË´áÂà§ÁµêÊûúÈ°ØÁ§∫ÔºåÊó•Êú¨‰ºÅÊ•≠ÂêåÊÑè‰ªäÂπ¥Âä†Ëñ™ 5.4% „ÄÇÂéªÂπ¥ÂêåÊôÇÊúüÔºåÊó•Êú¨‰ºÅÊ•≠ÂêåÊÑèÂ∞áËñ™Ë≥áÂπ≥Âùá‰∏äÊº≤ 5.1% ÔºåÈÄ£Á∫åÂÖ©Âπ¥Ë∂ÖÈÅé 5% Ôºå 2023 Âπ¥Ââá‰∏äÊº≤ 3.5% „ÄÇ Rengo ÁöÑÁõÆÊ®ôÊòØ‰ªäÂπ¥ÊâÄÊúâÂÖ¨Âè∏ÁöÑËñ™Ë≥áËá≥Â∞ë‰∏äÊº≤ 5% Ôºå‰∏≠Â∞è‰ºÅÊ•≠ÁöÑÁõÆÊ®ôÁï•È´òÁÇ∫ 6% „ÄÇ
‰ª£Ë°®Ë©≤ÂúãÂ§öÂÄãÊúÄÂ§ßÂ∑•ÊúÉÁöÑ Rengo Â∑≤ÊàêÂäüÁà≠ÂèñÂà∞Êõ¥È´òÁöÑËñ™Ë≥áÔºå‰ΩÜË¶èÊ®°ËºÉÂ∞èÁöÑÂÖ¨Âè∏ÂèØËÉΩÈõ£‰ª•Ë∑ü‰∏äÈÄô‰∫õÊàêÈï∑„ÄÇÊó•Êú¨‰ø°Áî®ÈáëÂ∫´‰∏≠Â§ÆÈäÄË°åÁ∂úÂêàÁ†îÁ©∂ÊâÄ (Shinkin) Â∞ç 12,817 ÂÆ∂ÂÖ¨Âè∏ÈÄ≤Ë°åÁöÑË™øÊü•ÁôºÁèæÔºåÂè™Êúâ 51% ÁöÑÂÖ¨Âè∏ÊâøË´æÊèêÈ´òÂü∫Êú¨Ëñ™Ë≥á„ÄÇ
ÂÖ©ËÄÖÁöÑÂ∑ÆÂà•Âú®ÊñºÔºåÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∏ Rengo ÁÆ°ËΩÑÁöÑÂÖ¨Âè∏Ëá≥Â∞ëÊúâ 100 ÂêçÂì°Â∑•Ôºå‰∏¶‰∏îÈÉΩÊúâÂ∑•ÊúÉ‰ª£Ë°®Âì°Â∑•ÈÄ≤Ë°åÈÅäË™™ÔºåËÄåÂπæ‰πéÊâÄÊúâÊé•Âèó Shinkin Ë™øÊü•ÁöÑ‰ºÅÊ•≠ÔºåÂì°Â∑•‰∫∫Êï∏ÈÉΩÂ∞ëÊñº 100 ‰∫∫ÔºåËÄå‰∏îÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∏‰ºÅÊ•≠ÈÉΩÊ≤íÊúâÂ§ßÂÖ¨Âè∏ÊâçÊúâÁöÑÂãûÂ∑•ÁµÑÁπî„ÄÇ
Êó•Êú¨ÂãûÂãïÈÉ®Êï∏ÊìöÈ°ØÁ§∫ÔºåÂ∑•ÊúÉÁµÑÁπî‰ºÅÊ•≠ÂéªÂπ¥Âπ≥ÂùáËñ™Ë≥á‰∏äÊº≤ 4.5% ÔºåÈùûÂ∑•ÊúÉÁµÑÁπî‰ºÅÊ•≠Â∑•‰∫∫Ëñ™Ë≥á‰∏äÊº≤ 3.6% „ÄÇÂéªÂπ¥Êó•Êú¨ÁöÑÂ∑•ÊúÉÂåñÁéáÂâµ‰∏ã 16% ÁöÑÊ≠∑Âè≤Êñ∞‰Ωé„ÄÇÂú®Âì°Â∑•‰∫∫Êï∏Â∞ëÊñº 100 ‰∫∫ÁöÑÂ∞èÂÖ¨Âè∏‰∏≠ÔºåÂè™Êúâ 0.7% ÁöÑÂÖ¨Âè∏ÊúâÂ∑•ÊúÉ„ÄÇ
Êó•Êú¨Ëøë 70% ÁöÑÂÖ¨Âè∏Âì°Â∑•ÈÉΩÂèóÂÉ±ÊñºÂ∞èÂûã‰ºÅÊ•≠ÔºåÂ∞èÂûã‰ºÅÊ•≠Êï∏ÈáèÊé•Ëøë 500 Ëê¨ÔºåËÄåÂÉ±Áî® 100 ÂêçÊàñ‰ª•‰∏äÂì°Â∑•ÁöÑÂ∞èÂûã‰ºÅÊ•≠‰∏çÂà∞ 66,000 ÂÆ∂ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÂæåËÄÖÁöÑÊï∏ÊìöÂèØËÉΩÊõ¥ÂèçÊò†Âá∫Êó•Êú¨‰∫∫ÁöÑÂπ≥ÂùáÊî∂ÂÖ•ÁèæÊ≥Å„ÄÇ
Ëñ™Ë≥áÊº≤ÂπÖ‰∏çÊïµÈÄöËÜ® Á∂ìÊøüÂ≠∏ÂÆ∂Ë°®Á§∫ÔºåÂç≥‰ΩøÊó•Êú¨Ê∂àË≤ªËÄÖÈÄöËÜ®ÁéáÊåÅÁ∫åÁ∂≠ÊåÅÂú® 3% Â∑¶Âè≥ÔºåÂæàÂ§ß‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜÂãûÂãïÂäõÁöÑÊî∂ÂÖ•‰πü‰∏çÊúÉÂæóÂà∞Â§™Â§ßÁöÑÊàêÈï∑„ÄÇÂéªÂπ¥Êò•È¨•Ë´áÂà§‰πãÂæåÔºå7 Êúà Rengo ÁöÑÊúÄÁµÇÁµ±Ë®àÁµêÊûúÈ°ØÁ§∫Âü∫Êú¨Â∑•Ë≥áÂè™Â¢ûÈï∑ 3.56% ÔºåÂéüÂõ†ÊòØÈö®ËëóÂ∞èÂÖ¨Âè∏ÁµêÊùüË´áÂà§ÔºåËñ™Ë≥á‰∏äÊº≤ÁöÑÂπ≥ÂùáÂ¢ûÂπÖ‰πüÈö®‰πã‰∏ãÈôç„ÄÇËÄåÊîøÂ∫úÁöÑÊúàÂ∫¶Â∑•Ë≥áÂ†±ÂëäÈ°ØÁ§∫ÔºåÈÅéÂéª‰∏ÄÂπ¥ÁöÑÂ¢ûÂπÖÊõ¥Â∞èÔºåÁ¥ÑÁÇ∫ 3% ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÄÇ
Êó•Êú¨Â∞è‰ºÅÊ•≠Â∑≤Á∂ìÊ≤íÊúâÈå¢ÊèêÈ´òÂ∑•Ë≥áÔºåÊó•ÂúìÂÖåÁæéÂÖÉÂåØÁéáÊåÅÁ∫åÂú® 150 Â∑¶Âè≥ÔºåÈÅ†‰ΩéÊñº 10 Âπ¥Âπ≥Âùá 121 ÔºåÊó•ÂúìË≤∂ÂÄºÂ∞çÂ§ßÂûãÂá∫Âè£ÂïÜ‰æÜË™™ÊòØ‰∏ÄÂÄãÁ¶èÈü≥Ôºå‰ΩÜÂ∞ç‰æùË≥¥ÂéüÊñôÈÄ≤Âè£ÁöÑÂ∞èÂûã‰æõÊáâÂïÜ‰æÜË™™ÂçªÊòØÂÄãË≤†ÊìîÔºåÂ∞èÂÖ¨Âè∏‰πüÂæàÈõ£Â∞á‰∏çÊñ∑‰∏äÊº≤ÁöÑÊàêÊú¨ËΩâÂ´ÅÁµ¶‰ºÅÊ•≠ÂÆ¢Êà∂„ÄÇ
‰∏≠Â∞è‰ºÅÊ•≠Âç†Êó•Êú¨ÂúãÂÖß‰ºÅÊ•≠ÁöÑ 99% ÔºåÂÉ±Áî®Êó•Êú¨ 70% ÁöÑÂãûÂãïÂäõÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏≠Â∞è‰ºÅÊ•≠‰∏çÂ§ßÂπÖÊèêÈ´òËñ™Ë≥áÔºåÂÄã‰∫∫Ê∂àË≤ªÂ∞±ÁÑ°Ê≥ïÂ¢ûÂä†ÔºåÊó•Êú¨Á∂ìÊøüÂæ©Áî¶‰πüÂ∞±ÁÑ°Êúõ„ÄÇ

topics: Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news

author: Sam Gutelle
title: Amouranth‚Äôs ‚ÄúAI girlfriend‚Äù earned $34,000 in revenue during its first 24 hours of sales
text: Kaitlyn Siragusa is one of the [highest-earning streamers](https://www.dexerto.com/entertainment/amouranth-reveals-staggering-all-time-earnings-from-onlyfans-1866478/) on the internet, but her ‚ÄúAI counterpart‚Äù isn‚Äôt too far behind. The woman known online as Amouranth revealed that her foray into the world of AI took in $34,000 of revenue during its first 24 hours of sales activity. In May 2023, Siragusa announced that she had [teamed up with a company called Forever Voices](https://www.tubefilter.com/2023/05/19/amouranth-forever-voices-companion-bot/) to develop ‚ÄúAmouranth AI,‚Äù an artificial intelligence molded in her likeness. She advertised the AI as a ‚Äúcompanion‚Äù trained to mimic her ‚Äúunique personality and inflections. Many of the 6.3 million followers on the [Amouranth Twitch channel](https://www.twitch.tv/amouranth) took advantage of the opportunity to spend time with Siragusa ‚Äî even if they were only hanging out with an artificial representation of the real Amouranth. In a follow-up to her Amouranth AI announcement tweet, Siragusa celebrated the product‚Äôs early success. She noted that the average buyer spent at least $20 to chat with the companion, and about 40% of chatters do not follow the Amouranth account. Subscribe to get the latest creator news AI COUNTERPART CLEARED $34,000+ in revenue in its first 24 hours! -Each person chatting (on avg) spent $20+ -a large portion of chatters don‚Äôt follow the account (40% thereabout) -I haven‚Äôt promoted it anywhere except in this tweet A lot of people are saying this type of [https://t.co/U0kK3LdSqO] ‚Äî Kaitlyn (@wildkait) [January 4, 2024] Siragusa has been an open book regarding her earnings. She has claimed to [make $15,000](https://www.tubefilter.com/2023/06/30/amouranth-sleep-streams-creator-economy-only-fans-conversions/) for each ‚Äúsleep stream,‚Äù in which her viewers watch her hit the hay. Those odd revenue streams supplement the income Siragusa makes on OnlyFans, where her monthly take [surpasses seven figures](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/amouranth-reveals-her-onlyfans-earnings-154510173.html). Amouranth AI has [drawn some criticism](https://www.thegamer.com/amouranths-new-ai-app-creepy-influencers-parasocial/) since its initial announcement. Detractors have argued that the companion is a ‚Äúcreepy‚Äù innovation that intensifies the parasocial relationships between creators and fans. The person who lends her likeness to Amouranth AI doesn‚Äôt see the product as a contributor to the [epidemic of loneliness](https://www.hhs.gov/sites/default/files/surgeon-general-social-connection-advisory.pdf). Instead, Siragusa argued that the companion is a source of relief for those who chat with her. ‚ÄúA lot of people are saying this type of thing is the cause of the loneliness epidemic ‚Äî I disagree,‚Äù [she wrote](https://twitter.com/wildkait/status/1743011351260172420). ‚ÄúThis doesn‚Äôt cause loneliness ‚Äî it‚Äôs probably closer to being therapeutic. It‚Äôs what people reach for to refrain from feeling alone.‚Äù

author: Jaelani Turner-Williams
title: Joey Lawrence Clears Up Rumors About Divorce, Says He Wasn't Having an Affair With Costar
text: Lawrence's third wife, Samantha Cope, filed for divorce this month, citing irreconcilable differences. Currently in the process of divorcing his third wife, Samantha Cope, actor Joey Lawrence denies that infidelity caused their breakup. On August 13, Cope, whom Lawrence shares a 19-month-old daughter, Dylan Rose, submitted paperwork for divorce, citing "irreconcilable differences." The former Gimme a Break star has been married twice before and shares two daughters, Charleston, 18, and Liberty, 14, with his second wife, Chandie Yawn-Nelson. On Thursday (August 29), Lawrence clarified the reason for his split from Cope, whom he married in 2022, claiming that he didn't have an affair with his Socked in for Christmas costar, Melina Alves. It was reported last week to People that the two had begun dating, with a source claiming that Lawrence "love-bombed" Alves. "With a deep sense of responsibility, I want to respond to the recent allegations surrounding my personal life, including my divorce and the claims of an affair with Melina Alves," Lawrence began in a statement on Instagram. "Melina and I became close friends and I did not have a physical relationship with her while filming the movie 'Socked in for Christmas'. These rumors are false," he continued. "Our bond was based on shared experiences and an understanding of the challenges we were both facing in our personal lives." Lawrence added that in meeting Alves during his "deeply troubled marriage," it was with Cope that he was "clinging to hope that I could save a relationship that, in my heart, I knew was beyond saving." "My short-lived marriage was fraught with difficulties from the beginning. Our differences became insurmountable," he wrote. Lawrence continued by calling his three daughters his "top priority" and that he had a "realization" that "there was no way my two eldest daughters were ever going to be accepted by my wife to be part of my family." "I cannot and will not compromise on the love and care that my daughters deserve, and this realization played a significant role in the breakdown of my relationship," he wrote. "I understand that my life is often in the public eye, and with that comes a level of scrutiny that can be difficult to bear," he concluded. "However, I must emphasize that the well-being of my children is of the utmost importance." Lawrence signed off by thanking followers for their "understanding and respect," but Cope responded with her own statement, calling her husband's accusations "deeply troubling." "I am confident that the truth is known to me, to Joey, and to God," she wrote. "I am choosing to put my focus on healing, caring for my daughter, and processing the loss of my marriage and my family." Lawrence and Cope met on the set of their Lifetime film My Husband's Secret Brother in 2021 and married one year later in Temecula, California.

author: ANI
title: Visits of PM Modi, US President paved way for "concrete strategic roadmap": USISPF CEO | International
text: Visits of PM Modi, US President paved way for "concrete strategic roadmap": USISPF CEO Mukesh Aghi on Friday said diplomatic momentum gained during the visits of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden paved the way for a "concrete strategic roadmap" and new initiatives between India and the US in various areas. [ANI](https://www.devdiscourse.com/ani-stories)| Updated: 29-12-2023 18:54 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 18:54 IST - Country: - United States US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) President and CEO Mukesh Aghi on Friday said diplomatic momentum gained during the visits of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden paved the way for a "concrete strategic roadmap" and new initiatives between India and the US in several areas. In a statement, Aghi stated, "The diplomatic momentum gained during the visits of Prime Minister Modi and President Biden paved the way for a concrete strategic roadmap and new dialogues and initiatives in multifaceted areas such as clean energy cooperation, education, space collaboration, semiconductors, quantum computing, drone technology, artificial intelligence, with accelerated joint projects such as manufacturing GE F-414 jet engines in India, putting India in the elite club of countries with such manufacturing capability." Earlier in June, PM Modi travelled to the US for a State visit. US President Joe Biden had invited PM Modi for a State visit. He also addressed a joint meeting of Congress before a State dinner at the White House. Later, US President Biden travelled to India to attend the G20 Summit under India's Presidency. He said that India and the US will build on the "deep defence synergy in new areas of critical and emerging technology with initiatives launched in 2023 such as iCET, and INDUS-X." He further said, "Together, with their Quad Partners in Australia and Japan, both New Delhi and Washington will remain steadfast in securing a free and open Indo-Pacific. Washington and New Delhi have also been successful in building new economic corridors of trust in the landmark India-Middle East-European (IMEEC)." USISPF Chief noted that 2024 will be the year to capitalize on building new trade links and new shipping and transport planes that will boost digital connectivity, create clean energy corridors, and strengthen India, Israel, the United Arab Emirates, and the United States (I2U2) collaboration in West Asia. "We look forward to 2024, as Washington and New Delhi continue their commitment to strengthening bilateral ties and reinforcing the strong bonds between two of the world's leading democracies," he said in a statement. Mukesh Aghi called 2023 an "epochal year" marking the third State Visit by an Indian leader to Washington, DC. He said India landed on the moon with the historic landing of ISRO's Chandrayaan-3 and world leaders gathered in Delhi to attend the G20 Summit. He stated that the G20 Summit in New Delhi marked a monumental year for India and marked Biden's first visit to India as the 46th US President. Hailing India's diplomacy at the G20 Summit, he said New Delhi was successful in voicing for global equity and a more "diplomatic and egalitarian world batting for the Global South." Calling India the "fastest-growing major economy," he said New Delhi has a bolder vision and added that it looks forward to hosting the Quad Leaders Summit in 2024. He said, "At a time of geopolitical fractures and global strife, India's adroit diplomacy at the G-20 Summit saw world leaders make a clarion call for peace and security and use diplomacy as a primary tool for conflict resolution. New Delhi was successful in voicing for global equity and a more diplomatic and egalitarian world batting for the Global South." "As we look forward to 2024, India, now the fastest-growing major economy and the most populous nation in the world has a bolder vision. New Delhi will look forward to hosting the Quad's Leader's Summit in 2024, albeit, at a later date than originally planned," he added. US President Joe Biden visited India to attend the 18th G20 Summit held on September 9-10, marking his first visit to India as a US President. The two leaders reaffirmed their commitment to deepen and diversify the India-US Major Defence Partnership. During the G20 Summit, India and the US also settled the seventh and last outstanding World Trade Organisation (WTO) dispute over poultry products. Notably, the six previous disputes were resolved during PM Modi's state visit to the US. (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) author: EHN Curators
title: Early BPA exposure linked to increased risk of chronic health issues
text: A recent study suggests that even low-level exposure to bisphenol A during childhood may raise the risk of heart disease, diabetes, obesity and other health conditions later in life. Pamela Ferdinand reports for U.S. Right to Know. In short: - Bisphenol A ( BPA), commonly found in food packaging, can disrupt hormones and increase health risks when exposure occurs early in life. - The study tracked over 3,000 Portuguese children, linking higher BPA exposure to elevated insulin levels, greater body fat and increased waist circumference. - Researchers urge global reduction of BPA in food packaging, citing potential risks even at low exposure levels. Key quote: "We conclude that global strategies need to be developed and implemented to mitigate bisphenol A exposure. This demands modifications, not only in consumer behaviors, but also in the adoption of innovative approaches by the food and food packaging industries, to ensure a substantial reduction of BPA exposure." ‚Äî Researchers at the Institute of Public Health at the University of Porto Why this matters: Exposure to endocrine-disrupting chemicals like BPA is widespread, yet research continues to uncover long-term health impacts. Regulatory and consumer shifts are needed to protect young children from chronic conditions linked to BPA and similar substances. Relevant EHN coverage: Everyone is likely overexposed to BPA ‚Äì EU usrtk.org

title: Rennes : Incidents lors d‚Äôune manifestation contre la loi immigration
text:
20minutes.fr Rennes : Incidents lors d‚Äôune manifestation contre la loi immigration Lire l'article complet 20 Minutes avec AFP 26 janvier 2024 √† 0:33 AM
CONTESTATION - La manifestation √† l‚Äôappel de mouvements d‚Äôextr√™me gauche se poursuivait vers 22 heures
Plusieurs centaines de personnes, masqu√©es pour la plupart, ont d√©fil√© ce jeudi soir dans le centre de Rennes pour d√©noncer la loi immigration, brisant au passage plusieurs vitrines de commerces et br√ªlant des poubelles. Cette manifestation sauvage, √† l‚Äôappel de plusieurs mouvements d‚Äôextr√™me gauche , rassemblait environ 450 personnes en d√©but de soir√©e selon la pr√©fecture. Parti de la place Sainte-Anne vers 20h30, le cort√®ge a sillonn√© le centre-ville derri√®re une banderole proclamant ¬´ loi raciste r√©ponse anti fasciste ¬ª.
Les manifestants, souvent v√™tus de noir, ont bris√© au passage plusieurs vitrines de commerces et tent√© de mettre le feu √† une agence bancaire place Hoche. Un magasin d‚Äôhabillement du centre-ville a √©galement √©t√© pris pour cible par des manifestants qui ont bris√© la vitrine et emport√© des v√™tements. Plusieurs poubelles ont √©galement √©t√© incendi√©es, selon la pr√©fecture. La manifestation se poursuivait dans les rues du centre-ville vers 22 heures.
Elle intervient quelques heures apr√®s que le Conseil constitutionnel a tr√®s largement censur√© la loi immigration . Le gouvernement a annonc√© qu‚Äôil s‚Äôappr√™tait √† promulguer le texte ¬´ dans les prochaines heures ¬ª pour appliquer les premi√®res mesures ¬´ d√®s ce week-end ¬ª. title: Loretto Boys Weather Storm at Summertown - NewsBreak
text:
By AJ Good ,
5 hours ago The Loretto boys basketball team has been making waves all season long. They are the lone undefeated team left in the state of Tennessee and have put up a lot of big numbers along the way. That was tested Tuesday night as they battled their biggest rival in Summertown.
